briefdescription.para: Get the current version of the CnossosPropagation shared library.

simplesect.para: String encoded version of the shared library.

briefdescription.para: Get the frequency range for the spectral data.

parameterdescription.para: Array in which to return the frequency bands associated with spectral information passed to and from the shared library. If a NULL pointer is specified, the function returns the number of values that would have been written on output but does not transfer any actual values.

simplesect.para: The number of frequency bands.
It is up to the caller to pass in an array of sufficient size. Applications can determine the minimal size of this array by first calling the function with a NULL argument.

briefdescription.para: Get material pointer.

parameterdescription.para: Unique textual identifier for the material
If a material with the given name does not exist and this flag is set to true, the library will create a new material; otherwise this function returns a NULL pointer.

simplesect.para: An opaque pointer to the material or NULL if no material with the given name exists and the create_if_needed flag is set to false.

briefdescription.para: Get the ground factor for a given material.

parameterdescription.para: An opaque pointer returned by a call to CNOSSOS_P2P_GetMaterial
New value of the ground factor

simplesect.para: true if the call succeeded, false otherwise

briefdescription.para: Set the ground factor for a given material.

parameterdescription.para: An opaque pointer returned by a call to CNOSSOS_P2P_GetMaterial
New value of the ground factor

simplesect.para: true if the call succeeded, false otherwise

briefdescription.para: Get the flow resistivity for a given material.

parameterdescription.para: An opaque pointer returned by a call to CNOSSOS_P2P_GetMaterial
Value of the flow resistivity (in kPa.s/m²)

simplesect.para: true if the call succeeded, false otherwise

briefdescription.para: Set the flow resistivity for a given material.

parameterdescription.para: An opaque pointer returned by a call to CNOSSOS_P2P_GetMaterial
New value of the flow resistivity (in kPa.s/m²)

simplesect.para: true if the call succeeded, false otherwise

briefdescription.para: Get the spectral absorption factor for a given material.

parameterdescription.para: An opaque pointer returned by a call to CNOSSOS_P2P_GetMaterial
Array containing the values of the absorption factor spectrum

simplesect.para: true if the call succeeded, false otherwise

briefdescription.para: Create a new calculation engine.

parameterdescription.para: If specified, initializes the engine for the specified calculation method

simplesect.para: An opaque pointer to the newly created calculation engine

briefdescription.para: Delete a calculation engine created by a call to CNOSSOS_P2P_CreateEngine.

parameterdescription.para: An opaque pointer returned by a previous call to CNOSSOS_P2P_CreateEngine

simplesect.para: true if the call succeeded, false otherwise

briefdescription.para: Get the name of the currently selected propagation path calculator.

parameterdescription.para: An opaque pointer returned by a previous call to CNOSSOS_P2P_CreateEngine

simplesect.para: Pointer to a string containing the name of the method

briefdescription.para: Get the version of the currently selected propagation path calculator.

parameterdescription.para: An opaque pointer returned by a previous call to CNOSSOS_P2P_CreateEngine

simplesect.para: Pointer to a string containing the current version of the method

briefdescription.para: select the point to point method

parameterdescription.para: An opaque pointer returned by a previous call to CNOSSOS_P2P_CreateEngine
Textual identifier of the calculation method. Valid methods include "ISO-9613-2", "JRC-DRAFT-2010" and "JRC-2012"

simplesect.para: true if the call succeeded, false otherwise

briefdescription.para: Create a vertical extension representing a point source.

parameterdescription.para: height of the point source above the boundary profile

simplesect.para: A transparent pointer to a vertical extension record

briefdescription.para: Create a vertical extension representing a receiver point.

parameterdescription.para: height of the receiver above the boundary profile

simplesect.para: A transparent pointer to a vertical extension record

briefdescription.para: Create a vertical extension for a thin barrier crossed by the propagation plane.

parameterdescription.para: height of the barrier above the boundary profile
Pointer to the material covering the barrier, as returned by a call to CNOSSOS_P2P_GetMaterial

simplesect.para: A transparent pointer to a vertical extension record

briefdescription.para: Create an extension for a vertical wall acting as a reflector for the propagation path.

parameterdescription.para: height of the reflecting wall above the boundary profile
Pointer to the material covering the reflecting surface, as returned by a call to CNOSSOS_P2P_GetMaterial

simplesect.para: A transparent pointer to a vertical extension record

briefdescription.para: Create an extension for a vertical edge causing lateral diffraction of the propagation path.

parameterdescription.para: height of the diffracting edge above the boundary profile

simplesect.para: A transparent pointer to a vertical extension record

memberdef.argsstring: (double const &h, CNOSSOS_P2P_POSITION const segment[2], double const &fixedAngle)
memberdef.name: CNOSSOS_P2P_CreateLineSource

briefdescription.para: Create a vertical extension representing a line source segment.

parameterdescription.para: height of the source above the boundary profile
end-points of the source line segment as projected on the ground
explicit angle of view of the segment as seen from the receiver.

simplesect.para: A transparent pointer to a vertical extension record

Setting a fixed angle is necessary in case (inverse) ray-tracing is used for constructing the propagation path as each ray is considered representative of an implicit sector of propagation with fixed opening angle and having the propagation path as its bisector. If the fixed angle argument is set to zero, the calculation will explicitly calculate the angle of view of the segment as seen from the source, which is typically the case when using beam-tracing or image-source techniques for constructing the propagation paths.

briefdescription.para: Clear the propagation path data.

parameterdescription.para: An opaque pointer returned by a previous call to CNOSSOS_P2P_CreateEngine

simplesect.para: true if the call succeeded, false otherwise

A propagation path is created by successive calls to CNOSSOS_P2P_AddToPath. A call to CNOSSOS_P2P_GetResult will close the path and trigger the acoustical calculations. In order to restart the calculation for a different path, applications must call the CNOSSOS_P2P_ClearPath function before constructing a new one.
true if the call succeeded, false otherwise

briefdescription.para: Add a new control point to the propagation path.

parameterdescription.para: An opaque pointer returned by a previous call to CNOSSOS_P2P_CreateEngine
Position of the control point
Transparent pointer to a material as returned by a previous call to CNOSSOS_P2P_GetMaterial

Transparent pointer to a vertical extension record as returned by a previous call to CNOSSOS_P2P_CreatePointSource, CNOSSOS_P2P_CreateLineSource, CNOSSOS_P2P_CreateReceiver, CNOSSOS_P2P_CreateBarrier, CNOSSOS_P2P_CreateVerticalWall or CNOSSOS_P2P_CreateVerticalEdge. For intermediate boundary positions without vertical extensions, this argument is set to NULL.

simplesect.para: The number of positions in the propagation path after appending the specified control point

A control point is part of the boundary separating the solid 2.5D model from the air above. Control points can be located on the ground or on top of man-made obstacles. Altitude of control points is measured against a geo-spatial reference coordinate system. Vertical extensions encode information related to vertical objects extending above the control point's position. The height of a vertical extension is measured relative to the altitude of the control point.
A valid path should have exactly one source and one receiver vertical extension at its extreme points. Paths may start at the source and end with a receiver or vice-versa.

briefdescription.para: Get the acoustical results for the current propagation path.

parameterdescription.para: An opaque pointer returned by a previous call to CNOSSOS_P2P_CreateEngine.
Select the type of results to be returned

Array in which to return the acoustical results. If a NULL pointer is specified, the function returns the number of values that would have been written on output but does not transfer any actual values.

simplesect.para: The number of values written (or not) to the array of results or zero in case an error occurred in the calculation.
It is up to the caller to pass in an array of sufficient size. Applications can determine the minimal size of this array by first calling the function with a NULL argument.

memberdef.argsstring: (CNOSSOS_P2P_ENGINE *p2p, double const *Lw, CNOSSOS_P2P_SPECTRUM_WEIGHTING weighting, CNOSSOS_P2P_LW_MEASUREMENT_TYPE type)
memberdef.name: CNOSSOS_P2P_SetSoundPower

briefdescription.para: Set the sound power associated with the source.

parameterdescription.para: An opaque pointer returned by a previous call to CNOSSOS_P2P_CreateEngine.
Pointer to an array containing the sound power spectrum.
Weighting of the sound power spectrum
Measurement conditions for the sound power spectrum

simplesect.para: true if the call succeeded, false otherwise

briefdescription.para: Get a description of the last error that occurred in the acoustical calculation.

parameterdescription.para: An opaque pointer returned by a previous call to CNOSSOS_P2P_CreateEngine.

simplesect.para: Pointer to a string containing the error message.

briefdescription.para: Print the current propagation path to the application's default output device.

parameterdescription.para: An opaque pointer returned by a previous call to CNOSSOS_P2P_CreateEngine.

simplesect.para: true if the call succeeded, false otherwise

briefdescription.para: Print an overview of the acoustical results to the application's output device.

parameterdescription.para: An opaque pointer returned by a previous call to CNOSSOS_P2P_CreateEngine.

simplesect.para: true if the call succeeded, false otherwise

briefdescription.para: Set the current settings of the calculation options.

parameterdescription.para: An opaque pointer returned by a previous call to CNOSSOS_P2P_CreateEngine.
Data structure containing the new values of the options.

simplesect.para: true if the call succeeded, false otherwise

briefdescription.para: Get the current settings of the calculation options.

parameterdescription.para: An opaque pointer returned by a previous call to CNOSSOS_P2P_CreateEngine.
Data structure used to return the current settings.

simplesect.para: true if the call succeeded, false otherwise

briefdescription.para: Set the meteorological condition parameters.

parameterdescription.para: An opaque pointer returned by a previous call to CNOSSOS_P2P_CreateEngine.
Data structure containing the new values of the meteorological parameters.

simplesect.para: true if the call succeeded, false otherwise

briefdescription.para: Get the meteorological condition parameters.

parameterdescription.para: An opaque pointer returned by a previous call to CNOSSOS_P2P_CreateEngine.
Data structure used to return the current settings of the meteorological parameters

simplesect.para: true if the call succeeded, false otherwise

briefdescription.para: Process a XML input file and optionally produce an XML output file.

parameterdescription.para: An opaque pointer returned by a previous call to CNOSSOS_P2P_CreateEngine.
Name of an XML input file
Name of an (optional) XML output file

simplesect.para: true if the call succeeded, false otherwise

The name of the input file can include a full path specification or be a path name relative to the current working directory. The name of the output file can be either a full path specification or a path name relative to the location of the input file. Even if no output file is generated, the application can use the CNOSSOS_P2P_GetResult function to access the acoustical results associated with the path defined in the input file.

ref.tooltip: Encoding of positions using 3 dimensional (X,Y,Z) coordinates.
Encoding of positions using 3 dimensional (X,Y,Z) coordinates.
